cab.content: * ^-608 kl2l/Supplies/l919.c.03O\simm Ah.-W A R C A 3 I H 3 T.Removal of Base Supply Depots at Liverpooland Avonmouth.-ITote by the Secretary of State for War.^18With reference to V/ar Cabinet 126 (8), I have been in consultation with the Ministry of Shipping, and have agreed with Sir Joseph Maelay thatj as the matter is of no great urgency, the Depot at Liverpool should remain for the present.The position at Avonmouth is different as shipping requirements demand the clearing of R transit she^ and the removal of the depot; in these circumstances I have given instructions that action to this end should be talcen at theearliest nossible moment.DERBY.1st Hay, 1917.
